description:
Recently found out that Bangkok 900 is closing on Oct. 22, 2018. I'm definitely going to miss it. 


This place is a GEM. I used to walk by this place all the time, but it always looked closed. So I decided to give it a try and by far one of the only BEST Thai places in the area. Food is authentic, full of flavor and the employees are so kind.
author: Diana A.

description: The best Thai restaurant in San Francisco .  Test like mom home cook foods amazing , I highly recommend you sticky rid with sweet mango you will fall in love
author: Linda M.

description: They lost their lease! Hurry and get some while the getting is good. They're solid on all the basics, and about 2/3 the price of everybody else. So of course they're not gonna be around anymore, like everything else of great value. I plan to order a bunch of coconut milk soup and stuff it in the freezer
author: Amy T.

description: Boy am I happy to have this Thai restaurant right in my neighborhood. I'm going to go out on a limb and say this place is authentic based on how much variety there is on the menu. Any place that serves pad won sen (pad see ewe's less salty brother) is a win in my book. I wish they got rid of their $15 credit card minimum though since it makes it hard to go halves-ies on a check. Other than that though, this place is solid. (Best part is that it's truly a one dollar sign kind of place!)
author: Charles L.

description: Wow wow wow! Incredible food! If you're looking to treat your pallet with some Thai that's out of this world, then this is the place for you! Make sure to try their chicken mushroom soup, their spicy ground beef platter and their curry chicken. The portions are huge and the amount you pay is ridiculously cheap. The staff was very nice and welcoming. I'll definitely come back and recommend to all my family and friends.
author: Lupe R.

description:
Kind of hard to find since the outside looks like a typical SF home. Once inside, super dingy and ... Just overall felt... Dirty and old. We were there for takeout food. Glanced over the menu and was initially impressed by the price range for the dishes, but knew why the price was so low as soon as we got the food. Portion actually wasn't small, but the taste is just not there. I got the pad Thai, and I only had two shrimp in the whole dish. It also tasted super bland, no pad Thai sauce or flavoring whatsoever ( i.e. fish sauce, tamarind, etc). Noodles were oily but still stuck together in clumps - not sure how that was achieved. Friend got some chili shrimp with rice, and he only had 5 shrimp in his dish. Rest were onions, bell peppers, and other filler vegetables. Oily again and not very flavorful. 

Overall: C+
author: Susanna C.

description: This place may look like a hole in the wall, but their food is some of the best Thai i have ever had. Their yellow chicken curry is a must!
author: Rachael R.

description: I recommend the wide noodle soup with pork and shrimp, the vegetable green curry, and the larb gai salad. The staff there is so friendly. Other items on the menu are very good too.
author: Amanda T.

description:
A and I ate at Bangkok 900 this past Saturday before the SF Deltas game at Kezar. This place is 2 blocks away and I can picture it being a part of our rotation of restaurants for this season. While neither of us were particularly impressed with our food, you can't really beat the price and convenience. 

A and I were sat in the back corner of the restaurant and at this particular time (6pm), the sun was shining directly in my eyes for the duration of the meal. The restaurant wasn't full and we could have been sat anywhere else and this wouldn't be a problem. We didn't say anything but it definitely put a hamper on our meal. Anyways, we noticed how cheap the alcohol was with the most expensive BOTTLE of wine being $20. They even had a liter of wine for $10 but I am sure you get what you pay for there. A bottle of Singha was $3.50. In any case, this is really really cheap for alcohol at a restaurant but I could not partake due to medication. A, however, had a Singha. We also didn't eat any appetizers since we had spent the whole day getting loose on Filmore with Yelp. We had:

-Pad Won Sen ($8.50): This was mine and it was fine. I am currently treating an ulcer so bland Thai noodles were exactly what I needed. I would never order this if I was healthy though, especially considering that there were only 2 pieces of shrimp and not that much chicken. I was kind of upset with how much onion was in the dish considering the menu only mentioned scallions since I am not really supposed to be eating them. In any case, it got the job done even if I had to eat around a bit of the dish.

-Kaeng Phed Ped Yang ($10): This was A's which he ordered because it was the only red curry he could find on the menu. He liked it! I did not try it due to spice but it seemed there was a good amount of duck/pineapple in the curry. He ordered rice along with this which definitely seemed necessary in order to make this meal "enough".

Overall, I do think we will be back but more due to convince/price rather than food. It is a solid option if you're in the neighborhood but don't expect a particularly upscale or innovative dining experience. Also, the bathroom is TINY and made me feel a bit claustrophobic so if you have issues with that, maybe hold it and go elsewhere.
author: Carrie W.

description: Everything about Bangkok 900 is splendid. Their staff is friendly, the atmosphere of their resat aunt is relaxing and cool with good lighting. Their papaya salad with dried shrimp the best I've tasted. Their duck curry is delicious also.
author: Tracey H.

description:
SHOCKED this has 4 stars, but then again it's mostly 20-somethings that have the "munchies," so what do they know.

We ordered a shrimp pad-thai. There were four of us. There were three shrimp in the dish, shrimp not prawns. I complained about it and they said they would have to raise the price if there was another shrimp. So we shared three shrimp like rats sharing a piece of cheese. This place cares more about saving a penny then they do about their food quality; which is terrible.
The iced teas was not good at all either. The other dish we shared was duck over broccoli, (I think). They sheisted us again; the duck was just strips of fat. No meat. Looked and tasted old. 

I would spend the extra $1.50 per dish and go to the place lower Haight on Waller. I am guessing that the owner owns the building and they do this just to stay busy. It's a crusty depressing place and it shows in their food.
author: Chris L.

description:
Tasty Thai food, I will advice to take away since the place isn't nice at all. 
But the customer service is amazing really nice and kind people. 
Amazing appetizers and gorgeous PAD THAI.
author: Agostina D.

description: We've been wanting to try this place for some time. We thought since they were there for so long the odds were good that the food would be good. Unfortunately not good at all. The prices were much cheaper than the other Thai places we patronize, that will be a warning to us from now on. The dishes were all weak and under-seasoned. One chef special was missing the lemongrass and lime leaves. All meats were like rubber and over cooked. Overall I would say try just about any Thai place over this one. Sorry.
author: Sam L.

description: The inside is dirty. The outside is dirty. The health dept. score is scary. Why? I mean just get a bucket and some hot soapy water and start cleaning already. At least then I could order from you. I live across the street. But no, every time I try again, I am left feeling like, Ick! Why can't they take a little pride of ownership and clean this place? The food is OK, not great, but OK, but I'd still order regularly if it was at least clean.
author: Pearl R.

description: This is a really good restaurant, it has a cozy feel that is hard to find is San Francisco. I would recommend the chicken fried rice, and also they have the most amazing mango sticky rice.
author: Jupiter J.

description: $15 credit card minimum is insane. Food is decent however. Unless you're ordering for a family or have cash, try one of the many other great Thai restaurants in the Haight.
author: David O.

description: This place is really great I got there and the vibe is awesome. I ordered the fresh rolls and they were a amazing I went ahead and got some steamed rice to go with it and it was plenty oh my God we also got the boiled banana with coconut milk I highly recommend it and I'm going to try to make it home it was incredible. The server was also a great little character.
author: Roxanne M.

description: The place doesn't take card for less than $15? That is such a dumb policy. There are plenty of great restaurants in the area, go somewhere that'll respect you.
author: Andre T.

description: Terrible Pad Thai. Made from really thin angel hair pasta with very little flavor. Very disappointed!
author: Jen P.

description: The customer service is amazing. The owner is so incredible sweet and welcoming. For a Thai restaurant, this will be the most affordable place you will find in the city. The food is good, comes out fast and it's delicious. You genuinely will not find a better place. On top of that, it's conveniently located right in Cole Valley. Their lunch special is perfect.
author: Jenny N.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant on Parnassus campus. Since this is my last work trip, I put Bangkok 900 on my list of must dos. 

I had the tod mun - patties made from fish emulsion. Wonderfully delicious. I use this as a measuring stick for authenticity of a Thai restaurant. If it is not on the menu, it's not real Thai. If it taste like chicken, it is a Thai fusion. No regrets here. Dish came out piping hot and the peanut sauce with cucumber slices complemented each bite well. 

Tried the kiew tiew gai koor from the lunch menu. It was a simple fish - Pan fried rice stick with chicken, eggs and bean sprouts served over a bed of crunchy lettuce. Most places would have messed this up but not Bangkok 900. The sprouts were fresh and crunchy, the lettuce was crunchy and not soggy. Light sauce to show that you are eating rice sticks. Eggs mixed well with the noodles and not chunky or isolated.  A dash of scallions on the top gives it a pop. 

Don't be turned off by the white crocheted linens lining the windows. If you   are reading on your smartphone when food arrives, put down the phone and enjoy the steaming hot food. I have not found another Thai restaurant that serves piping hot food like here. 

Eat here, don't take out. The heat will be gone by the time you get home with the food. Dig in! Enjoy the free flowing tea. They pay attention to you and top up the tea before you realized the cup is empty.

I almost forgot. The owner recognized me and how long I have been coming to his restaurant. His sister is the cook preparing the dishes.
author: Khiang S.

description: I'm a regular here as the food is good and the prices very reasonable.  The staff are always very friendly and makes for a great experience even if you're getting takeout.  Some of my favorites include - Moo Yang, Kai Grapow.
author: Victor P.

description:
I had the Pad Won Sen.  My GF had the Dancing Prawns.  I didn't care for mine, but she loved hers.

Mine:  The noodles reminded me of Filipino pancit, and not very flavorful with small amounts of chicken, veggies, and egg.  Maybe it was the dish, but I'd never order it again.

Hers:  Beautiful presentation (see photo), and it probably took a bit of work to stuff chicken and crabmeat into those prawns.  The rest of the dish lacked in veggies, but the prawns were tasty.
author: Dirty D.

description: Inexpensive, delicious and quick Thai food, you really can't ask for much more. I've never waited for more than 10 minutes for my food. I order takeout from here roughly once a week and I have no plans to change that. All of their curries and noodle dishes are wonderful! On top of that, the main man Lek is a real gem-- he is super friendly, always asks how I'm doing, and is all around awesome. Bangkok 900 for life
author: Courtney R.

description: Did take out and they did not package the curry properly, which resulted in all the liquid to leak out. The food was still good though, so I guess I'll give it three stars. The pad thai was a little dry in my opinion.
author: RachEl L.

description: Wow!!!! Amazing quality food that brought me back to Thailand! Quick service with the best prices in town!!
author: Jeremiah L.

description:
This place is awesome. We so many Thai restaurants in SF this one always stands out. Very authentic cuisine and extremely tasty. The staff is so very welcoming, since we're regulars they know our names and that sure does make us feel at home. 

Highly recommended!!!
author: Luis L.

description:
Great local take out spot for Thai!
Always my go to spot in the hood.
My favorite dishes are Panang Curry & Pad Thai
author: Christina R.

description: Great food, fast service, and very nice people that work there. I usually order for pick-up and our food is always ready on time. :)
author: Nadia O.

description: This place was delicious! I tried a few of their items, and all of them tasted really good. They made it fresh and it came out fairly fast. Their Pad Thai was very good! I didn't like their prawn spring rolls that much, it didn't have any flavor, just a fried type flavor. However, their other foods were very rich.
author: I K.

description: This is one of those unassuming places you find out about on your own walking down the street one day and want to grab a bite to eat. Everything about this restaurant is humble; the food is great and simply prepared and the staff is friendly but not overbearing. It is one of those places that gives this city much needed personality and people a much needed respite from the more pretentious and aggressive dining experiences.
author: Richard C.

description:
The food here is always amazing.
For me the flavors are very authentic.
The owner is helpful and we are lucky to have this as a local spot. My go to is the duck curry, try it and I think you'll enjoy!
author: Xavier P.

description:
If you ignore the decor and focus on the quality of the food, Bangkok 900 stands head and shoulders above your average neighborhood Thai cuisine. The service is very friendly without being intrusive, and the staff are helpful to those who might need a little guidance around the menu. 
They do a mean pumpkin curry, and their pork with eggplant & basil is delicious!
author: Sambuddha S.

description: Excellent food, great service! Wait staff was very attentive and the ambience is laid back. We had the chicken pad Thai and summer rolls. Potion size was generous! Only critique is that there was a little too much peanut sauce (which was excellent!!) but it made the dish a little heavy. Will definitely be back!
author: Sara D.

description:
Bangkok is like ... the old, frayed, floral printed pair of granny panties that you wear on laundry day. It's there when you need it. You're not running around showing them off, and you're not excited to wear them - but in a way, you're happy to have them.

The menu at Bangkok covers all the basics of thai food. Many of the dishes are good-ish. Nothing is worth writing home about. I've tried a number of things (this is the closest restaurant to track practice) but I can't remember anything that stands out. Still, I leave with a full, warm belly. 

The staff is friendly, with a good sense of humor. The interior needs ... a lot of work ... but it has a bizarre, dated charm that feels somehow on-brand. I wouldn't ever tell you to stay away, but I wouldn't tell you to go, either.
author: Catie F.

description:
Bangkok 900 is the best!

Lek is the owner and an all around great guy. He knows my voice and order by heart. 

I eat here about twice per week. Their food is top notch, great for vegans, and typically ready in under 10 minutes. Great neighborhood spot for take out, or quiet dine in.
author: Lewis K.

description:
A big cut above your average neighbohood Thai place. I don't know why Bangkok 50@ doesn't get more buzz for its food. The price/quality ratio here is fantastic.

The produce is fresh, the seasonings are spot on and there's a lot of care and expertise in the preparation of the food. Unlike most Thai restaurants, the som tum is not too sweet, and it has the tiny dried shrimp that put it a notch above. I love the green beans and tofu dish. Sounds super simple, but I think they put fresh lime leaf in it, it has so much flavor. My friend swears by the pork with ginger and eggplant. 

Even the curries are a cut above- not heavy and gloppy, but lighter and vividly flavored. I used to live in the neighborhood, now I get takeout from here when I'm anywhere near Cole Valley because I miss this food!

I forgot to mention Lek, whose usually the waiter. He is so nice and friendly, and always remembers me when I come in. 

The one thing I'd wish they'd do is freshen up the decor and fix the lighting. It's too bright for me at night. Maybe turn the lights down and put candles on the tables.
author: Mary B.

description: I got lunch here to go and I am happy with the prices of the lunch special. They gave a generous amount (even though my pad Thai only had 2 shrimp in it). The waiter who took our order was very nice and patient. I also got a Thai iced tea. It was on the stronger side with a bitter after taste, but for $2.25, I can't complain. I would come back next time I am in the area.
author: Lynn T.

description: Great spot. Not huge portions but very good curries as someone who makes curries and has been to Thailand the red and green were no disappointments. Could have been spicier, as they were marked as such. Affordable cozy, pleasant staff.
author: Gahiji B.

description: The food was flavorful. I had the lunch special with chicken sate, veggies in red sauce it comes with a side of white rice and a small soup. Overall I was very satisfied with my lunch. I would eat  there again.
author: Mari A.

description: Today was my first time there and I tried the Pad Ew with beef! The food was super good! Love it! I will go back there soon! Super recommend!
author: Nina K.

description: This restaurant was convenient to where we were staying and the staff were helpful. Unfortunately, the food was average tasting. For example, the vegetables in my green curry were mushy.
author: Paula L.

description: Not bad, I work close to this joint. Did a couple of veggie entrees & it was good. Food was seasoned well, I'd ask them to do the broccoli the way the eggplant was. If you like heat go that way. Sneaky spice on the eggplant & little to none on the broccoli.
author: Henry K.

description: Good reliable neighborhood Thai restaurants I've been here several times.  But the greatest of ambiance, but good Thai food
author: Tony T.

description: Bankok 900 is the best! It's our go-to place for dinner on nights we don't feel like cooking because the food, the prices, and the service are great, and it's right down the block from us. Our go-to dishes are the green curry, papaya salad, and coconut soup, and we've never been disappointed! We typically do take-out, but the dine-in experience is cozy and pleasant too. Authentic, quality Thai food and friendly staff (that recognizes us by name) make this place one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants.
author: Becca Z.

description: We love this place, been getting take out here for years, The Yellow Curry Vegetable is definitely delicious!Our Relatives from Florida ALWAYS insist we eat here when they visit .Our go to Thai in the neighborhood.
author: Manny G.

description: Average Thai food, best for a take out. Nothing fancy about the place. The server / manager looked in a rush.
author: Doc R.

description: Came here for lunch with my coworker. Her suggestion. It's such a cute, quaint place straight out of a time machine. Probably haven't been redecorated in 10-20 years but that's what's appealing to it.  The food was affordable...right up my alley..u can get 2 item combo for $9.00 with rice. I would definitely come back. Service was excellent, price was right up my alley, decorations were nostalgic. Overall, good place to eat and food was delicious.
author: Cherry C.

description: Close to UCSF med center. Delicious. Had the mango & sticky rice for dessert...it was perfect. I'll be back!
author: Mary R.

description: Great food! I have ordered chicken fried rice and it is awesome and quick. The guy inside is welcoming. Will come back for sure. The price can't beat any other restaurants in sf
author: Anish A.

description:
HOW does this place have two dollar signs under "price" on Yelp?? Most things are under $10!!

I can't believe I've been living up the street from this place for 3 years and have never bothered to try it!

Although "Bangkok 900" sounds like a Crime Noir novel, it always appears to be empty, though I know a good amount of their business is takeaway. 

I went in with my SO yesterday evening and was very pleasantly surprised (and also sad, about the amount of times I could've already been enjoying BK900's delectable entrees).

Firstly, the decor is really cool. You can tell this place has been around a long time and is from another era in San Francisco. This is a very good place if you want somewhere quiet and charming to eat dinner. There is a second floor for seating, which, as per usual, was deserted last night. My only gripe about atmosphere would be the Top 40 hits playing quietly in the background. Personally, I'd prefer something more traditional with such an old beauty of a restaurant.

The food was great. We had the crispy rice paper wrapped shrimp appetizer that came with sweet and sour sauce. The shrimp tasted fresh and had a great crispy texture with the deep fried rice paper. He had a dish with duck and spinach, I ordered the yellow curry with chicken. We both added a side of steamed rice ($1.50) each. 

His duck was great, very succulent and flavorful with the sauce. But my yellow curry, oh my goodness! The chicken was not at all dry or overlooked but very tender and delicious. The curry was the perfect amount of creamy with a slight spice, it's honestly the best Thai yellow curry I've had in a good long while. And at $7, you really can't beat the price.

Our server was great, the hot tea we ordered was constantly being refilled. We also, admittedly, ordered 15 minutes before close, and offered to get our food to-go just so we didn't hold them up from closing. He said it was alright, no problem at all, and did everything out of his way to accommodate us. We still did our best to finish up in a timely fashion and took our dessert to go.

When we got home and tried the mango sticky rice, it was heaven. Such sweet and warm rice with very ripe mango slices. A truly decadent treat after such a stellar meal.

We will definitely be back to eat here!
author: Megan D.

description: It's not much to look at but the food eats good. I was surprised by how flavorful the Peneang Nuer (beef curry) was. Pad Thai was good too. A local gem if you are looking for a very low key and affordable meal with minimal ambiance.
author: Andrew G.

description: I love this place.  Good people.  Yummy food.  Been ordering from them regularly for 15 years.
author: Karla D.

description: It's just amazing.  Everything is delicious. Have not had one thing that I don't like. Everythung is ready in 10-15 minutes. Lek is the main guy there. He is great and recognizes the regulars by their voice.  And he is not fake nice either. I've had him be frustrated with me when I can't decide over the phone or hang around too long on a busy night. He is an all around genuine guy
author: Jack H.

description: An awesome place.  The curries are some of the best in the city and everything is reasonably priced.  While the decor is dated inside, the food more then makes up for it.  Has been a regular stop for years - and probably the best service in the city - the employees know me and my friends by first name.
author: Adam O.

description: Their curry is top notch! The best I've found in the city, and I eat a lot of thai food. Legend has it they used to be packed all day and hard to get a table years ago. It's tucked away from other restaurants or stores, so there's less foot traffic. But the foods still as good as it ever was.
author: Luke B.

description:
Yet another amazing Thai place in the city, and probably the best I have ever had. 

FOOD:
I had Spring rolls, lemongrass soup and Pad Thai and ooooooh my sweet god. Those Spring rolls. I still have dreams about them sometimes (jk but seriously they were out of this world). The soup was so tasty, warm and cleansing, I felt my whole body was thanking me for having it- by the way it's the best way to cure a terrible hangover. 

AMBIANCE:
It's really -REALLY- quiet there. Perfect place to take your ladies on a date, guys. The decor is superb and it feels cosy and comfy inside. Honestly they do do takeout but I'd rather sit there and enjoy my food in their peaceful dining area. 

SERVICE:
Efficient, quick, nothing to complain about. 

PRICE:
Oh yeah, and they are cheap too. Seriously how did I not know about this place. 

Thanks for an amazing dinner, Bangkok 900, you can know count me as a regular.
author: Sev G.

description: What a pleasant t surprise !!! The food was absolutely delicious - extremely cheap - a great place to go to and have a great time (don't expect a fancy place though)
author: julien b.

description: Always love coming here. Great neighborhood Thai food at an amazing value. Tell Lek (the waiter) Makenna sent you!
author: makenna n.

description: Lived in the Cole valley neighborhood for over a year and have seen this place several times but have never eaten here until now. Food was extremely affordable ($10-12) for dinner and delicious. I had some kind of seafood with chef special sauce and it was fantastic. Also, had the beef sate as an appetizer and it too was phenomenal. Also, had my first Thai iced tea and that was delicious as well. Highly recommend this place for a cheap neighborhood Thai place. 10/10
author: Brady A.

description:
Had an excellent takeout experience.

I ordered spicy Tofu Pad Thai and it was quite possibly the best I've had in the city. It was very flavorful. Very quick preparation time and inexpensive. Docking a start because I'm a bit disappointed that they do not have pad kee mao or pad see ew on the menu. 

That being said, I am a bit of pad thai junkie and Bangkok 900 has earned their spot as my go-to for take-out pad thai. The dining-in experience is not as stellar; the restaurant could use a face-lift but is on par with other local thai restaurants.
author: Caroline L.

description: Super friendly and quiet place to grab lunch or dinner. Food was delicious and customer service was great! Highly recommend!
author: Mitch C.

description: Solid good food, reasonable service, and all at a competitive price.   I like this place.
author: James M.

description: Good, but not great food. I really don't like the feel of the restaurant, it was very overcrowded at lunch time for my tastes. Cheap food and excellent service though, so deserves 4 stars from me.
author: Peter C.

description: This is by far the best reasonably priced restaurant in cole valley. I order pretty often and I've tried a lot of the menu items. The wide noodles, currys and soups are my favorite. Always a good time here, very hardworking staff that remembers everyone's name and order. Lek if you read this, you're the best. Always up for a quick chat and a laugh. Try it, you won't be disappointed.
author: Luuk S.

description: Surprisingly good Thai food, given the extremely unassuming exterior. Very reasonable prices. The service was attentive and kind. The cashew chicken was quite good, and the house fried rice of all things was amazing. Simple, good, tasty food.
author: Sarah G.

description:
I could've given more them five stars because, the food is excellent and delicious!
I will definitely return for more.
author: Tinho M.

description: I love love love me some Bangkok 900. The tofu satay is AMAZING! I don't know how they make it taste so freaking delicious. My two other favorites are Pad Ke Mao with tofu and the Tofu Kaprow. Perfectly spicy with huge chunks of tofu and veggies. Plus the people that work here especially Lek are wonderful! Yum yum in my tum!
author: Eryn L.

description:
When you're looking for an easy night of yummy Thai, come here. 

Fast takeout, easy location and nice staff-
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Decent price, about right for what one would spend for Thai food. I love the food here. Portions are good and the taste is awesome. Highly recommend this restaurant
author: Chris C.

description: This was my go-to take away dinner for years when I lived in Cole Valley.  Consistently delicious Thai food and friendly service kept me coming back.  Now that I've moved to another SF neighborhood, when I get a chance to come here for dinner, it's like coming home - it's comfort food that satisfies the palate and the soul.
author: Louise V.

description:
We've been going to this place for years as it is close and the food is awesome,. Those of you who've only gone once, or on an off night, don't know what you are missing. We are BIG eaters and we can stuff ourselves for $25 bucks here, easy. We've eaten Thai food all over SF and the world and this place is the real deal. 
Get the chicken sate and mus a mun curry and you will have a happy belly!
Lek and Joe are always welcoming and the more often you go, the more they will treat you like the king or queen you are.
author: Roberta D.

description: Always deserted because it's a local takeout place, Bangkok 900 is a favorite of the neighborhood for good reason.
author: Ken C.

description:
This is our favorite Thai restaurant in the city, and a place we missed terribly during our short exile to the Peninsula.  

Lek is the man, the noodles have good wok hei (Google it), curries are well balanced, and the meats/seafood always taste fresh.

Peter and I get takeout from here so often that when we call, Lek starts the conversation with whether or not the mangoes are ripe enough for the mango/sticky rice dessert.  What a stud.
author: Nicole L.

description:
dine in: bangkok spring rolls (not deep fried), tom yum salad, mu-sa-mun curry, singha beer... staff was very friendly and professional. let us finish our beers although we were the last customers and they were starting to close down.

food was served family style and is very rustic in presentation - but the flavors are totally on point! we un-abashadly wolfed down every scrap of food on the plates, which is why i have no pictures to share.

will absolutely return for more delicious thai food!
author: Lorraine Y.

description:
I've been ordering out from Bangkok 900 for over 10 years.  And would drive there to pick it up but I have lived in Cole Valley and Nopa during those 10 years.  I love that they have delivery now.  It always hits the spot, the cost is modest and the food is great for those looking for mild curry options.  If I want spice I got to the original Osha Thai on Geary.

My go-tos are the pumpkin duck curry, green beans, pad thai, and larb
author: Diana L.

description:
I really do enjoy the food here. Orders are small, Yes, but I'd say very tasty. I always order the chicken PadSeww. The noodles are always delicious. The chicken is usually bland.... But i don't mind it. The noodles absorb all the soy sauce so the bland chicken blends nicely with the salty flat noodles. Bangkok 900 makes a mean green curry!! My favortite!! 

I live a few blocks away so delivery is always fast and friendly. 

If you've dined at the restaurant, you've probably met the friendliest waitstaff ever!! They're so inviting and genuine. I love eating here and chit chatting with my buddies at Bangkok 900.
author: Andrew V.

description: Living near this place, I walk by regularly. Not only is the health inspection number disgusting, the exterior is absolutely filthy. If I owned a business I would be out front, cleaning, washing and repainting regularly. It is so dirty, I do not understand how anyone can give the place any stars at all. I really would never be able to eat here knowing this is the standard of cleanliness. Imagine what makes it into your food? Argh! No way.
author: Anne S.

description:
A couple. 

The only patrons of this place on a Saturday night.  Yeah, I was worried.

But the homey ambiance of this two-storey resto, replete with a handful of traditional Thai decorations and Christmas lights that seem to haven't come down well, since Christmas, made us stay.  Plus the genuine smile of the owner helped too. 

The menu has a good variety of familiar Thai dishes which are reasonably priced.  The most expensive entree I saw on the menu is priced at $11, just to give you an idea.  There are nothing over $5 for wines by the glass.

We chose to stick with the classic pad thai, papaya salad, Pad ka prow (ground chicken cooked with Thai basil, chilies, bell peppers) with steamed rice.   The pad thai had sparse trimmings, I counted 4 pieces of shrimp, a couple slices of fried tofu, bean sprouts and some green onions.  I liked the generous serving of their papaya salad and the pad ka prow was tasty, thanks to the amount of oyster sauce used. 

Surprisingly, I still had room for dessert.  The boiled banana with coconut milk is a no frills way to end the meal. 

We had a highly efficient server, a bit robotic, but no complaints!  

This place seems like a reliable neighborhood Thai place.  Our server was constantly taking orders on the phone and from patrons who were dropping by for take out.
author: Janice C.

description:
Of all the Thai restaurants near Upper Haight, this is my favorite one. Their service is very fast and their food is absolutely delicious. I'm picky about my Pad Thai. It can be a challenge to find a Thai restaurant that knows how to combine salty and sweet just right. Look no further! This is the place for fantastic Pad Thai. 

Their green curry has good rich texture and very flavorful tender meat. Their waiters are always very courteous and attentive. I'm never disappointed when I come here to dine..
author: Caroline N.

description: My sister & me were looking for some where good to eat close to Haight Street & stumbled upon this amazing place. It was empty, but I read the Yelp reviews that it's a local take out & super good & the reviews were correct. So good, great prices and the staff is so nice. Will come here again!!!
author: Jennifer R.

description: I love takeaway from this place.  It's so good! The best I've had...possibly anywhere.  Neighborhood gem.  Check it out!
author: Corey H.

description: Great value and surprisingly quiet - possibly because a lot of people get takeout rather than stop to eat. I'd like a wider range of beers but that's a minor quibble - this is a convenient place to eat after a day in the park. We were served by a very quiet man who was the only waiter but was always attentive without crowding us in the least. We had a prawn curry, a salad and a chicken dish and they were all excellent - I'm looking forward to going back and trying out some other things.
author: Steve B.

description:
Got 7 dishes to go and it was about $85. Three of the plates were "main" dishes - fried rice, noodles, pad Thai etc. What we really got were probably only 3 true dishes when it came down to size. The portions are extremely small. Food was salty and barely mediocre. 

Probably not a good place to get to-go family style meals.
author: Shirley T.

description:
Average all over the board. I was the only one in there, 8p on a Sunday, btw. Server was ok. Brown rice was ok. Cucumber salad ok. Prawn Ga soup really sweet. 

It was quite and affordable. Definitely has those two going for it. Probs. won't be back since there's Thai on every corner in this town. However, they don't use MSG. Another big win.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Fast takeout! I ordered and it was ready within 15 minutes. Close to King of Thai-quality chicken curry, but the serving size struck me as tiny--half the size of the normal chicken curry serving I've gotten anywhere else; however, the mushroom soup serving was twice as big as most places...not pleased about that.

Very fast service and sweet people, so I'd go back and try more things.
author: Lauren C.

description: One of my favorite Thai spots in the city . Super affordable and fast . I love the tofu kaprow! Lottsa vegan options and happy toaccommodate , The staff is great - especially Lek, Lek is the best!!
author: Thrustin D.

description:
This place is a hidden gem. Honestly, not a lot to look at atmosphere-wise. But the food is delicious. All the curries are great. And anything that has their peanut sauce is amazing. 

The prices are reasonable. I just ate there for lunch for the first time. Lunch menu runs between $6.50-$9.00. The dinners are just are in the $9-$12.00 range. 

Mostly I order deliver from them rather than going in. The delivery is speedy, about 30-45 minutes depending on what was ordered and if it's a busy night. I've never had food arrive cold. 

Oh, and it you at the restaurant the wine by the glass is ridiculously cheap. Some of their wines are $3.50 a glass.
author: Tom F.

description:
Quick and easy for delivery, they graciously deliver up in the hills while most places around Irving will not.

I've had the Pad Kee Mao twice now as take out and have been very satisfied, it comes rather spicy unless you request for the heat to be simmered down which they will respectfully do without any lip.

I kept a single take-out menu for future, and I can't wait to put it to use when I have cravings for simple, yet delicious Thai food again.
author: Ty T.

description:
Based on others' reviews, I wasn't expecting much but I went tonight with my gf and a friend and we were thoroughly impressed. Authentic, fresh and delicious. 
We all agree it's our new, go to Thai place.
author: Deniz U.

description: I had a quick dinner few weeks ago and remember particularly the Bankok Fresh Roll. It was excellent and half a dinner by itself. Good thing I was really hungry. As a main course I had Gai Garprow which I enjoyed too. The service was fast and friendly. A TV was on somewhere in the room with a sports channel which took the Thai a bit away. I'd prefer some Thai music to go along with dinner to complement it.
author: Ernst W.

description:
Strapped for time and requiring delivery on a Sunday night, I quickly discovered just how few places actually deliver to the Alamo Square area. It was actually a little depressing.

Bangkok 900, however, does deliver -- and on time, at that. 

I called at about 5pm on a Sunday and got quoted a time of 40-50 minutes. It was there in under 30, piping hot. My only gripe was they didn't include chopsticks and I didn't have any of my own (lame).

The food was average. I had the Pad Thai J and the Massamun Beef curry. I really liked the former. The latter wasn't my cuppa, but that's probably more because I'm not a huge fan of red meat than a judgment on the dish's actual quality. I also ordered a thai ice tea, because reasons.

All told, I think I paid about $22-24 with tip, which I thought was reasonable.

Is it my favorite Thai restaurant so far? No. But it's got quick service and a decent menu, with adequate serving sizes and good flavor. It heats up well too, from what I've seen.

Yay, reliable delivery in San Francisco! I thought it was just a myth.
author: Andrew S.

description: Ordered from them for lunch and got a combination plate that came with Goong Mum Mu (deep fried shrimp in egg roll skin) and Gai Karprow (spicy ground chicken and fresh basil). The shrimp was okay and what made it interesting was the egg roll skin that it was covered in. The Gai Karprow was excellent! I loved the overall taste of it and the extra spiciness came from a few chopped jalapenos that were added to the portion. I would give this place 3.5 stars.
author: Jam P.

description:
I could probably eat here everyday for the rest of my life. I'm pretty much always craving their food...well, the yellow curry chicken in particular w/ a thai iced tea and mango sticky rice for dessert! 

I think my bf gets annoyed at me because whenever he asks me what I want for dinner I always say Bangkok. Who needs variety when you have amazing thai food just around the corner?!

Oh, and did I mention their great service? If you prefer take-out, they can make your order in under 15 min too!
author: Jeannette N.

description:
This is the best-kept (though I'd love to see them flourish!) secret around. My boyfriend and I eat here regularly. The thai coconut-based curries are so good, I want to drink the sauce when the veggies and meat are gone.

Even their simple veggie dishes, which I usually go for, are great. Nothing too fancy, but everything tastes fresh, never too oily. I also love that we can get brown rice here (it's actually an amazing, fragrant red rice) instead of white.

Portions aren't huge, but I always feel satisfied when I'm finished without feeling stuffed. I totally appreciate that. I was little underwhelmed by the mango with sticky rice dessert, but wanted to lick the plate after the fried bananas with honey. Mmm!

I love a place where I peek in the kitchen and see all women in there cooking! It's how you know it's close to the real deal.
author: Alex M.

description: Good, inexpensive food, fast and friendly service. Would definitely come back. I got the pad se ew (dinner size) and a Thai ice tea for a total bill of $10.60. Was very quiet when I was there (Friday at noon), so not sure how the service is when it's busy.
author: Kyle J.

description: Been coming here for years. They've gotten rid of their Angel Wings, which were the best in the city. Prices haven't changed much, but portions have definitely shrunk. Still very good food and always excellent service, despite being an Asian restuarant.
author: gary l.

description:
Not amazing, not funky, Bangkok 900 is OK. Ordered the red curry with duck and the flavor was pretty one dimensional and unexciting.

They do make a really good peanut sauce.
author: Daniel K.

description: This is first time eating dinner here. If you love Thai food and want to try really good food its on the corner on Stanyan Street. We ordered vegetarian dishes like the Tom Kha veggie and green curry and eggplant dishes. I would recommend this place to my family and friends!!! :)
author: Jantima J.

description:
Living across the street from this restaurant is really dangerous! The food is really good and it's very inexpensive for the amount of food you get! Lek always helps me at the front desk (or as our server) and he is the best! He is always very friendly and makes you feel welcome!

You can find all the traditonal thai dishes including many vegan friendly options here at the restaurant! Some of my favorites are:
-#81 Tofu Karprow - sauteed tofu with bamboo shoots and fresh chili sauce (HELLA good!!! ...if you like spicy) - $6.95
-#87 Pad Thai J - fried rice noodles with tofu, vegetables and bean sprouts (ask without egg) - $6.75
-#83 Tofu Kao Pod. Sauteed tofu, baby corn, mushrooms and green onions. - $6.25
-#7 Crispy To-Fu Appetizer served with sweet and sour sauce $5.85

They have a $15 minimum if you want to use your card. I would just bring cash because it's easier for you and the restaurant. This restaurant is a must try if you like thai food! =)
author: Anthony H.

description: Really delicious Thai food. Got the eggplant basil with tofu and green curry and it all is so tasty. The curry has a lot of ingredients in it as well. This is def one of my fav Thai places now!
author: Lisa W.

description: first time dropping by... a bit disappointed with the portions.  I ordered 2 dishes a beef salad and duck salad to go.  I spoke to them in Thai/isan accent...so they know I should know my Thai food.  picked up my order..it was extremely light...probably about a pound for 2 dishes.  when I opened it..unsurprisingly there were just a couple of pieces of meat and big chucks of lettuce... was extremely disappointed I could have made my own laarb (minced meat salad) but didn't have time to...so my friends were also disappointed because it looked looked left over from the restaurant. maybe dining in would be a different experience...I will try again next time...so I can give a better review.
author: Sandra S.

description:
Best Thai in the 'hood

I just got back from six months in Thailand and I've tried all the Thai restaurants in the Haight. This place wins for sure. 

The Good:
- Super fast. Food is always ready for me to pick up within 10 minutes of calling. I've called, left my house immediately, and it was already sitting there - do don't waste anytime if you call for pick-up or it might get cold. 
- Curries are very flavorful. They use the perfect amount of ingredients in all their curries. Proportions of meat to veggies to broth is always spot on. I like that. 
- The little guy who is always working is cool. He remembered me after about the third time I ordered here. At this point he already knows who it is when I'm calling and he grabs my order as soon as he sees me walk in the door. 
- Best Thai food in the neighborhood.

The Bad:
- Not spicy enough. I always order VERY spicy and it's never spicy enough. But no place in SF ever is. 
- $10 an entree is 10 times more than what I'm used to paying in Thailand. 
- Dining room. I've never eaten here and never will. The building is cool from the outside but the inside is really drab. The layout is really, really cool and if they remodeled this place they could really do something awesome with it. But as-is it's kinda depressing inside. 

If you need Thai food in Haight/Cole Valley, this is your joint.
author: mike t.

description: Bland. Unpalatable. Completely underwhelming. This place is for people with no tastebuds or desire for authentic Thai food. Ordered pad thai and pad see ew for delivery. Save your money and order somewhere else.
author: Melanie M.

description: This is my all time favorite Thai place... Perhaps my all time favorite restaurant! The service is incredible, there is never a wait, and their food is delicious (perfect pad Thai!). They are so kind and even accommodated their smaller space to fit our group of 30 once(wedding rehearsal)! My water is always refilled promptly too!
author: Morgan B.

description:
Delicious thai food! And I must say, I eat Thai food pretty often and I can get pretty picky when it comes to quality and ingredients, having that said this place is a gem! Seriously, this place is the real deal.


I had a dish called pad see ew and it was delicious! the broccoli was fresh. Not very common, you can tell they care about ingredients. 

-Very clean 
-great great great service! Food was made very quickly
-thai tea, yum
 -A F F O R D A B L E, no dish cost more than 10 dollars (rare in SF)
-great atmosphere
 great for dates, family dinners, a binge for yourself
-lots of seating 
-authentic
-great great service
author: Jo P.

description: I like this place because the owners are very personable and kind and I think that counts for alot. Their food is just ok... Not super good but definitely not terrible either, and when im starving from attending to my clients back to back with no break for hours on end, their pad thai or the yum woon sen salad makes me very happy... Plus our immediate neighborhood doesnt have that many options. Minus 1 star because the inside smells like grease so thats a little ick, but i usually get my food to go. Minus another star because sometimes they arent open when they say they are... But excellent customer service and decent food.
author: Debra K.

description:
Yelp's two star "meh. I've experienced better" definition fits this place. 

The quantity and quality of the food is sub-par (my pad thai was really ketchup-y) and our order didn't even come with utensils or napkins. Maybe I'm being a bit nit-picky but COME ON...This was probably the first and last time I'll eat/order from Bangkok 900. The only nice thing was the free delivery (with a $15 dollar purchase).
author: Vanessa Y.

description: I wanted to like this place because it's the closest Thai to my place, the guy running the place seems very nice...but alas, no.  It's not bad but just so very average and lacking in flavor underneath the salt and chili sauce.
author: Eric C.

description:
Great Pad Thai, the green curry was a little greasy and the spring roll appetizer was just weird (mustard on top of a poorly rolled- roll).  
  Delivery time took over 40 mins on a thursday night.  I would order again because the curry had a ton of chicken and eggplant, rather than filled with bamboo shoots.  The pad thai was fresh, with bean sprouts, peanuts and excellent prawns.  Hopefully next time, not so greasy
author: Laura M.

description:
Thai takeout in walking distance sounded promising. 

I ordered green curry and an appetizer. 

The staff was courteous, the wait was short, the food was not that great. The rolled appetizer was undistinguishable and didn't make it anywhere except into the garbage. The curry itself had good flavor, though it suffered from more shitake mushrooms than chicken and wasn't something I'd want to order again. 

I've sadly discarded the takeout menu and learned an $18 lesson - try elsewhere for thai takeout.
author: Jen Y.

description: I've been to a lot of Thai places, and this is hands down the best. Bonus points for being in my neighborhood. Reasonably priced and always delicious, I used to stick with the same old thing at Thai joints (red curry) but now eagerly try something different each time I come here. Each dish I swear is better than the last, and Lek always welcomes my husband and I with graciousness and warmth.
author: Katherine C.

description:
My favorite Thai place in the neighborhood is Siam Lotus on Haight St., but since Bangkok 900 is less than 500 ft. from my house, I decided to give it a try today.  I ordered my usual dish: Chicken Pad Kee Mow ($8.35 at pick up).  

I've always noticed how drab the place looks and how there's only ever one table in use, but it's got potential--I really wish they'd do away with the dark lighting and kitchen curtains.

To the food:
The first thing I noticed about the dish was the lack of bamboo shoots, my favorite part, but that's okay, it's not really for the American palate.  However, I was disappointed with the dish overall.  It was waaay too salty--had a lot of soy sauce.  It also didn't seem fresh because there was a slight fishy taste (not comparable to fish sauce).  I've only made it through a third of the dish so far, but it's too salty to continue.

It seems that what people rave about is the curry.  I usually make my own curry, but I'd give it a try at Bangkok 900 before writing off the restaurant completely.
author: Linda H.

description:
Delivery based review.

Fast, tasty, polite service. I called in desperation the other night after being abandoned by another delivery place. (I'm truly not that lazy, it had been a long day). I begged, BEGGED, them for fast delicious food. Bam - under 20 minutes, at my door. Hooray! I love the eggplant. Shrimp dishes can be so-so. But for rescuing me they get all the stars. All of them.
author: Marie J.

description:
Ordered Tom Kha with shrimp- it was literally coconut milk with mushrooms and shrimp-- what about the veggies??

Also, $10 min for credit cards.
author: Amaranta C.

description:
don't order the fresh spring rolls. as they have mustard on them? not sure why that is? and they aren't real fresh more like I actually gagged when I took a bite

otherwise its okay thai food.

Not winning any awards but, not the worst in the world. I would eat it again cuz its really close
author: Nathaniel S.

description:
The friendly staff at Bangkok 900 now know me by name. Anytime I work late and get home hungry - they're open and welcome me in with open arms. It's a relaxing, fuzzy warm kinda feeling to walk in here 'where everyone knows your name'.

A real neighbourhood spot, I saw the guy behind the counter (sorry, forgot his name), at the newly opened Lower Haight library. 

On the downside: The food isn't that great for takeout. Flavour is a little on the low side.
author: Ryan D.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant in the city, hands down.  Been going here since 1998, when I lived around the corner.  Now it's worth the trek across town for the perfect gai kaprow and tofu with peanut sauce and vegetables.

Lek and Joe treat their customers like family; they even delivered to the UCSF maternity ward the day my child was born.  Now, that's service!
author: Amanda K.

description:
Matt and a couple of his co-workers had a project near the area. With the recent obsession of Thai food, we landed here for lunch. This quiet corner restaurant is located in between the busy Haight St. and UCSF. It is also located across the street from Kezar Stadium. 

We were very hungry, so we ordered a bunch of variety plates. For starters, we begin with a Crispy Tofu w/ Sweet and Sour sauce. For a Beef plate, we had the Panaeng Curry Beef for $7.25. For poultry dish, we had the Gai Yang Chicken, which is a marinated chicken pieces with Sweet and Sour Sauce. For seafood, we had a $10.00 dish that had Prawns sauted with baby corn, mushroom and green-onions (don't know the name). And finally we had one of the chef's special: the Pad Ta Lay ($10.00), which is mixtures of seafood covered in Hot Chili Sauce. Each of us had a plate of rice and Thai Iced Tea. 

It sounds like a feast, right?

Indeed it was for three of the big boys with a huge appetite. With a balance of spicy and mild plates, we're very satisfied with the outcome of this Thai-restaurant.
author: Matt G.

description: Friendly and really cheap prices for lunch. Got my pak kee Mao for only $6.60! Definitely best prices for lunch and friendly service.
author: Christina L.

description: This is probably my favorite place for Thai food. Just a caution to others though. The food is quite authentic and it's not super Americanized. Possibly my favorite dish is the dancing shrimp. The guy who always works there recommended me that dish and the preparation of that dish is quite pristine and that sauce is quite amazing. I wish I can replicate that sauce. Another thing that I like here is the papaya salad. This is probably the only place in SF where I would buy papaya salad. I have been to many places like Osha, Ler Ros, Baan Thai, and so forth and nothing comes close to this place. The key ingredient is that the papaya is crushed with palm sugar and you can taste the richness of the sauce that goes with this salad. My only complaint about this place is that the portions are quite small but I think that is a motif here living in the city. I come here at least once a week and it's always not busy. I hope they stay in business and the guy who works there is super nice.
author: Gary I.

description: Best Thai food in San Francisco. Delivery is FAST and super affordable. Food comes HOT. Tastes great every time.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Meh.

We have been in search of a good Thai restaurant that delivers to our place, and we decided to give a try to this place.  

-Vegetarian Pad Thai had only 3 pathetically tiny pieces of fried tofu, and it was not well seasoned.  
- Moo Prig Khing (Pork with green beans)  tasted Okay, but they gave me such a little amount of food that I could see the bottom of the container before I had the first bite.  

It was sooooo disappointing that we wished that we had stuck to our regular 3.5 star place in neighborhood!
author: Ryoko M.

description:
So, after eating here I feel slightly underprepared to write this. Mostly because I have no idea what I ordered. I've eaten Thai food three times now in my whole life. So I don't have a "Thai go to dish". I like curries. And I like Pad Thai. Thats all i know.

Walking into the place I was caught a little off guard. It seemed a little out of place where it's located. I think I was expecting greasy spoon meets the far east. What I got was a simply decorated but warm space that was much bigger than one would've guessed. 

Our waiter was a mild mannered middle aged gentleman who seemed timid but kind. He seemed eager to help but I think there was a little language barrier issue that left him a little self conscious. I was ok with it. I mean, I'm ordering Thai food from a dude from Thailand is he supposed to sound like someone from jersey shore?

 I went with some kind of curry. It had shrimp, cucumber, bell pepper and egg plant. First, everything was delicious. Secondly everything they approached with a knife it looked like they did so with a dexterity of a seasoned surgeon. A skilled surgeon who who has a passion for running hole in the wall Thai spots. Back to the flavor. I don't know exactly how to best describe it. Subtle spiciness that builds a little. Your nose will likely start running before you realize your mouth now resides in hell, in the best kind of way. We ordered shrimp wrapped in egg roll wrappers as an app and my girl got some kind of fried noodle dish. I think she liked hers. I think I forgot to ask as I was distracted by food. 

Expect to pay from 7-9 bucks for dinner. Add an app and a Thai iced tea and your closer to 16. Still very worth it for what you get. It's easy to do in SF, but try to not to overlook this place. For us it was a wonderful surprise.
author: Jarred D.

description: The Food was delicious, and prepared in a timely manner. It had a comfortable and private feel. The interior was immaculate, and the staff was very friendly. We tried the Peanut curry with shrimp, and Yellow curry. Both were delicious!
author: Michael G.

description:
I was highly suspicious when we stepped inside the restaurant and we were the ONLY patrons there.  It was a Monday though, so we gave it a shot...and I'm so glad we did.  The service was very efficient - not particularly welcoming or overly friendly - but very efficient.  Me: "Do you have sticky rice?"  Waiter: "No.  I'll bring your Singha."

Anyway - all of the food was delicious.  NIce sized portions, but not too huge.  I had a delicious eggplant dish.  The boyfriend had a pad thai dish.  We started with tofu skewers.  Everything was tasty, tasty, tasty.  I'd go there again...more to see if it the food can repeat itself in yumminess and to see if the waiter has lightened up at all.
author: Mac M.

description:
We came here at Christmas Eve, simply because all of our other top choices were closed for the holiday.

The place was empty and dimly lit, which further lowered our expectation.  

The meal was fantastic!  Everyone in our party was happy stuffing our faces.  Wait staff was quite friendly and accommodating, even the chef came out and said hello during our dinner, even as they got busier later.  

Worth a try when you're in Cole Valley!
author: daphne w.

description:
I used to eat here but stopped for some unknown reason.  (Probably because it was a place I went with a now ex-boyfriend. . . )  But we were in the mood for Thai and this place delivers so we gave it a try. We got the yellow curry chicken, chicken sate, the eggplant veggie dish and the papaya salad.  All of it was good!   The curry chicken was a little spicy (in a good way) and the sate had a really good flavor.  I liked the eggplant although it seemed a tad on the oily side for me.  The papaya salad wasn't the best I've had but it was a good meal and everything seemed fresh.  I would recommend ordering from this place, for sure.  The delivery was quick and friendly.  The food is a little less heavy than the Indian food I've been eating lately, and the prices are really reasonable.  I'll be ordering from there again.

Also the steamed rice was good and sticky (yum) and they don't rip you off for it, which I appreciate.  I could cook my own but I'm too dang lazy!
author: Anne F.

description:
parking is tough to find, you'll have to drive around a bit.

the food tastes good.  the portions seem very small or completely controlled in a tight way.

i ordered the pad sew which was very tasty but like i said small.  slightly salty or too much soy sauce.  i'd ordered this before and it was bigger once before.

my friend ordered the fried rice and added shrimp.  he received 3 shrimp.  they charged 3 dollars more.  1 dollar per shrimp?

well, needless to say, my first time it was really good.  this last time, i'm probably going to go somewhere else.

but if you're hungry and this is the only place around...its at least okay to eat here.  the food isn't bad, its just not proportionate to the price.
author: Bing D.

description:
Easy going and basic neighborhood Thai joint. Ain't nothing special, a solid go-to place. 

I've had most of the curry and pad thai dishes, never let me down. 

If you can name a mediocre city in Thailand (not Bangkok), the food is probably like that. 

900 is for their address, I think.
author: Kenny H.

description:
This is what a neighborhood place should be: comfortable inside (not fancy), friendly (not pretentious), reasonably priced, and serving very good food. And, yes, I realize the final item in my list isn't parallel with the others, but I'm too sleepy to care. My belly is full of Bangkok 900's lovely green curry chicken, steamed rice, and, wonder of wonders, the most luxurious mango with sticky rice I've ever swooned over. 

Do not miss the mango with sticky rice. I'm a late adopter of this particular sweet, and when I think of all the times I had the chance... Well, now I know, right?

So, there you have it. Go there. Eat. Swoon. Be happy. Life is good, and even if it sucks, at least you'll be eating good Thai food. As for me, I've already been there once tonight, so I'm going to just go to bed (and, yes, I'm happy!).
author: J. C.

description:
They know me by name. I used to live across the street and up a few buildings. This is not the best Thai place around, but it's pretty damn good, and for the right price. The restaurant is often empty or near empty, but they do a lot of take-out business. The staff is friendly, especially if you are a repeat visitor. I recall there Pad Thai not being great, so I usually stick to the curries and other noodle dishes.

I will be going to Bangkok on December 30th, so I will finally find out what authentic Thai food taste like. Or will I? What is authentic American food, does anyone know, would anyone agree? Anyway dear reader, I will then be able to sound almighty and powerful like those other reviewers who say "Oh my, this is just not the same as the food I had in Thailand. Go to blah blah blah because blah blah blah is like what I had in Thailand.

Damn, now I'm craving some Thai tea. How do they make that stuff?
author: Ken L.

description:
In terms of Thai, this is the best place we have gone to eat at together thus far. The place itself is nice, never crowded with lots of seating on two floors (it seems to be utilized more as a take-out hub). It is both clean and has a friendly staff. The food itself, while not awe inspiring, is good. The portions, aside from the curry, are generous while still being very tasty.

The only downside is the beverage selection, in particular that they only have one beer to choose from (Singha, which was "decent"). Still, it's the type of place we wouldn't mind going back to if we are craving Thai.
author: Sami R.

description:
UPDATE: May 31, 2011:
I went back here after not having been for probably a year.  Chicken sate was very good.  But my beloved Mussamun as described below in my original review:  no.  It still had the glob of oil in the middle, and this time not only wasn't the sauce as flavorful as last time, but the meat didn't look great ("mystery meat"?) and too fatty.  I couldn't finish it.  As there are so few restaurants in SF that serve Mussamun, I'm gonna have to stick with Suriya for that from now on.  Also, not much different from a lot of Thai restaurants, but their "to go" cups for Thai Iced Tea are embarrassingly small.    Three stars for the sate, plus, since my review below, they appear to have come to their senses and lowered their prices -- it was very reasonable this time -- and the interior has a nice warm feeling and the service is good.  So, all is not entirely lost.  But, in the end, it's all about the food, and for this main dish, it ain't happenin' anymore, and I'm afraid this probably will continue to not be a "go-to" Thai place for me.

---------------------

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
I was torn between giving Bangkok 900 a 3- or 4-star (where is 3-1/2?  lol), but will have to settle for a 3.  I came away from this place with few fond, lingering memories, but there were two:

First, unfortunately, is the bad memory: it seemed a wee bit expensive for where it's located on its lonely corner and with minimal atmosphere.

But, the good memory:  Mussamun Beef Curry!  I first had this dish in LA (the capital of Thai food in the U.S.) and it was amazing -- essentially, it's beef stew, Thai style, with potatoes and peanuts.  The traditional way is using cubes of beef that melt in your mouth and are easily cut with a fork, same as in good American beef stew.

The majority of Thai restaurants I've been to in SF don't even have the item on the menu, and I've subsequently found out that it's a very regional dish.  But of the ones that do have it on the menu, they use sliced beef which, if I haven't been led down the wrong road, is simply not the way it's supposed to be made, and I can certainly tell you that the dish is not very special without the cubed beef.

So this restaurant is the first one I've been to here that not only carries it, but generally makes it the right way.

Now, that said (and the reason I say "generally" above)...

Someone else here mentioned that they had a curry dish there and there was a big glob of oil in  with the sauce, as if it hadn't been mixed properly (or shouldn't have been in there in the first place).  I'm afraid that that is the case with the mussamun too.  I did my best to leave the oil in the serving dish while carefully spooning out the best of the sauce.

Ok, yeah, I know, why bother.
author: Merrick W.

description:
My roommate has been coming here for 6+years and took me here for a traditional yummy Thai meal. I am new to the neighborhood so this was the perfect place for me.
Im obsessed with the veggie soup and tofu skewers w/ peanut sauce. Their veggie curry is to die too! They also have an array of meat dishes that are good from what i hear, but im more of a veg/fish gal. Usually we get food delivered, but once in awhile we dine in the restaurant. It's a family run business, so the staff is super friendly and the food is great & affordable. I love the Thai tea, and probably drink a whole pot when im there. The waiter noticed this and even gave me a to-go pack, how sweet is that! 
I love this place and will be back again & again..and agian.
Yum!
author: Meg O.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have been interested in checking the place out. I picked up some quick chicken Pad Thai to go and it was great and well priced. Will try them again!
author: Josh T.

description: Some of the best yellow curry I have ever had, and their rice was fantastic as well. That's not the sort of thing that stands out too often to me, but their rice was perfectly cooked. The staff is also very polite. I will definitely be back for their lunch specials.
author: Katie S.

description:
Now that I've moved to Cole Valley it's time that I start representing my new neighborhood. what what!

Bangkok900 is right on my corner, and I am a HUGE fan of Thai food, so I was really hoping for a good experience - and to my immense happiness, I got it.

I walked in and ordered take-out (and was surprised to see the place completely empty at 6pm on a weekday).  The decor is very clean and simple, with folded cloth napkins sitting up on every plate - nice, but still casual.  The man who took my order was happy to describe the difference between a couple different curry dishes, and I decided on the Panaeng Nuer.  My food was out in under 5 mins!

When I got home and started eating, all my roommates watched my food with extreme envy.  It was SO delicious, hot, and fresh - slightly spicy but mostly sweet and coconutty.  The beef slices were tender and the curry sauce was AMAZING.  This might possibly be my new favorite Thai dish since I usually get Yellow Curry Chicken but was feeling the need to branch out.

Because the prices and the food are so great, and since this place is less than a block from my house, I sense it will soon become one of my new favorite restaurants in SF.
author: Laura W.

description: Eggplant is delicious, waiter is very friendly and personable. Affordable dinner (about $10) and just a nice place. Can't wait to to back!
author: Formerly Picky Eater J.

description:
Very good yellow curry and extremely polite staff.

About the best Thai you're going to get in the Cole Valley/Haight-Ashbury.

I will definitely be back to sample more of the menu.
author: Seth S.

description: I have been coming here for years.  Lek and the staff are great.  The food is really very good.  Not every dish here is created equal, but the red and green curry is good.  So is the beef with wide noodles.  I highly recommend.
author: Thomas S.

description: I just ordered some Shrimp Pad Thai to go and in the whole container there were only TWO shrimp. The noodles tasted fine, but seriously, only two?!
author: Natalia K.

description: Bangkok 900 features friendly and responsive service, and serves entrees of varying quality. The sautéed beef slices with bamboo shoots and chili sauce was pleasantly spicy, but the beef was overcooked and tough. On the other hand, the mild curry with prawns and potatoes was flavorful and the ingredients were tender (this is a good option for more sensitive palates).
author: Chris T.

description:
Love this place.  Gone there dozens of times and never been disappointed.  Delicious, authentic, and affordable Thai food.

The wait staff are professional, courteous and attentive.  And, the food comes out quickly.  Definitely fast for a quality sit-down restaurant.  And, their take-out is extraordinarily fast.  Usually about 15-20 minutes (max!) between the time that I order and when I can pick it up.

It's also one of those places that, while it has a dedicated neighborhood clientele, is almost never crowded, so you can take your pick of the tables and get good service right away.

I had gastronomically unadventurous family visiting from out of town (the kind of folks who don't know what Thai food is) and this place won them over.  During a one-week stay, they asked to go back twice!

There are a lot of Thai food restaurants in the city, but this one edges out most of the others in my book because of its quality food, clean, quiet atmosphere, affordability and friendly staff.
author: Leftcoast G.

description: Solid Thai food.  3 stars are b/c some dishes are outstanding (e.g. curries) and others inconsistent (e.g. pad thai- at times outstanding, others =only OK).   They deliver and have great, fast service.  I go back again and again and...............
author: p w.

description: We've had great food from Bangkok 900 -- the duck curry is delicious, and the pad thai always hits the spot. Friendly delivery people and good phone service. We haven't eaten in the restaurant yet, but the takeout food has restored my love of Thai food!
author: Caitlin M.

description: I still love their Garlic Chicken, but when I wrote my last review, I was waiting on my second order....and I waited and waited and waited. They took over TWO HOURS to get my food. In fact, when I called to ask if something was wrong with our order, they snapped at me on the phone!  "It's coming!" then they hung up. The food was FREEZING cold! No apology, no coupon for next time. Even worse, no menu!!! ARG!! I'm still going to keep giving them chances though. I hope it was a fluke!
author: Jena D.

description:
My friend has been raving about this place for quite some time, and I've been meaning to try it.  Well, today was the day.

My friend from Fremont drove to the City, and we took his car to Bangkok 900.  Word of advice: do NOT drive your Mercedes S500 to areas where street parking is at a premium.  I mean, I have a pretty big car, but this thing ... it's something else.  We found a spot right in front of the restaurant, but it took me about 5 minutes to cram that German masterpiece between an old Honda and a Mini Cooper.  Mission accomplished.

We walked in at 5:55 pm.  The place was completely empty.  12 or so tables downstairs and 10 or so on the second level, all unoccupied.  What gives?

We ordered crunchy tofu and veggie spring rolls as appetizers.  Both were very good, although the portions were slightly smaller than I've seen at other places.  They also skimped on the peanut sauce; come on, how much could that possibly cost?  I ordered my usual: Pad Thai with chicken with a side of steamed rice.  Pad Thai was really good, although chicken was a bit hard to find.  I think a couple of the pieces were dark meat, eww.

The service was excellent.  Our waiter, who was maybe 5 feet tall with his shoes on, was fantastic.  He was quick, efficient and attentive.  I mean, it's not like he had other customers to focus on or anything, but still.  Very impressive.  Our bill came out to $44 with tip (crispy tofu, veggie spring rolls, chicken Pad Thai, veggie Pad Thai and 4 diet cokes).  I was full.

We walked out of the restaurant at 6:45 pm.  Still, the place was completely empty.  Over the course of nearly an hour, not a single person stopped by.  How is that even possible?  Order takeout, ask for change, anything?  I know the economy is in the toilet at the moment, but you gotta eat!

I'll be back very soon, and I'll bring my normal size car next time.
author: Yan G.

description:
Yikes, some of these reviews are harsh! I would not give Bangkok 900 any less than a full four stars. Not even if someone asked my nicely.

I lived in Thailand for a time, most of which I spent eating. I can't state that seriously enough. So I feel pretty literate in Thai cuisine. 

Bangkok 900 is not the best Thai in the city, but it's only a step (maybe step-and-a-half) down from that. A little inconsistent, like most American Thai food, but I've had some seriously decent curries. For me, curries are the real test -- a good green curry speaks volumes about a Thai restaurant. And Bangkok 900's green curry is soundly good. On par, let's say, with that of Ploy II. 

The food is good -- and reasonably priced -- but the real special value of this place is the absolutely fabulous man who seems to run the dining room and take-out service. I wish he were my uncle (even if he is only 16 years old, which his stature implies). The service is lovely and the space ain't bad either. And you will never have to worry about getting a table. Ever. Ever.
author: Beah B.

description:
This place is absolutely horrible. This place serves imitation-Thai food. It's nothing more than Chinese food in a thinly veiled disguise. We ordered Pad Kee Mow, aka drunken noodles with chili basil sauce. What we received in no way resembled any form of Thai food which I've ever eaten. Couldn't even eat any of the food which was delivered. Had to throw everything out. Pure garbage.

THIS IS NOT THAI FOOD!
author: Brian J.

description:
One night a friend and I ordered take out from this place.  Well that was a mistake. 

The only positive thing I can say about this place is that our food was ready when they said it would be.  I picked it up and walked back to the apartment waiting for some good food.  Boy was I surprised!   We ordered the Thai Fried Rice with Chicken and the Pad Thai with Chicken.  Both were gross!!!  The meat they used was the cheapest most disgusting meat.  I mean seriously, you don't use cheap chicken with tendons attached for Chicken Fried Rice or Chicken Pad Thai.  Yuck.  Chicken isn't even that expensive.  To top it all off the rest of the food had no flavor.  We ended up throwing it away.  

No love for Bangkok 900.

Seriously though, why be in the business of food and skimp on quality food?!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
3.5 stars.. Just finished inhaling my dinner!

I ordered take out:

Yellow curry with potatoes and chicken - delicious a little sweet, very yummy
Brown Rice - I love restaurants that serve brown rice
Some veggie and tofu dish with heart of palm - meh, it was ok

AND for dessert - Mango sticky rice - yumyumyumyum... It sounds weird, but the sticky rice is sweet and topped with sesame seeds.. and with the mango it's the perfect marriage of the two flavors!

I will definitely order take out from this place again.
author: Monica S.

description:
I am a simple man. I sometimes need pure sustenance. This is what Bangkok 900 offers. This is not to imply the food is bad, just not excellent. I sometimes work near here and go here often. Pizza, Burgers, coffee or Bangkok 900. I've never been to Thailand, and as I am not an expert I fail to see the point in labeling it unauthentic. It's sustenance. If you're stuck in Cole Valley and in the need of some quick food that is decent then go here. 

On a more positive note, their service is top notch and super friendly. Every time I get delivery, it's very fast and they never screw up the order. I enjoy their yellow curry and I really like their poh-pier, which is a kind of egg roll.
author: Redd J.

description:
Love it, love it, love it.  Lek (the guy normally behind the counter) is a great guy and a lot like that character from that Billy Joel song "Piano Man".  You know, the one who is quick with a joke or to light up your smoke (not the guy in the Navy).  I don't smoke but I imagine that if I did he might go so far as to come outside and light me up.  

The service is lighting F-A-S-T for both takeout and dine in.  I'm talking in and out within 10 minutes for takeout.  We've never had delivery (too embarrassed to have food delivered a block and a half) but I've heard from friends that it is speedy.  The place is never that crowded so there aren't any lines.  Everything I've had there (almost all the vegetarian and seafood dishes) have been delicious.  We particularly like the sweet and sour soup with prawns.  

Between the good service, the great food and my boy Lek, I would definitely recommend Bangkok 900.  I take all my out of town guests there for at least one meal.  While you're there, a couple things to ponder:  What's the significance of the 900?  And does anyone ever dine up on the second level?  Hm.  

I don't know if there's some place that Lek would rather be, but I know that I love me some Thai food at Bangkok 900.
author: Steve B.

description:
Great place to bring kids!

Bangkok 900 is our local Thai place.  The thing is it took us years to realize how great it is, because it always looks so vacant inside that I thought that might bode ill for the food.  Well, they do a thriving take-out business, so it's not like people are avoiding them.  Finally I realized, that with 3 kids, the lack of people in the dining room suited our needs perfectly.  That's when I realized the gem I'd been missing out on.  It's  now my kids' favorite place.
