The gentleman who runs the place quickly got to know who we were when we started coming back again and again, and gives us excellent, good-humored service--even has our order memorized.  In addition to the chicken sates the kids devour, my husband and I always get the calamari salad, and they serve a beef dish with the most amazing dipping sauce for the steamed vegetables, ever.  It was so good the next time I came back my whole order was  vegetable plate with that sauce and I'm not the biggest fan of vegetables. (I wish I knew what it was called to recommend it.) I always get the mango sticky rice for desert....so delicious.  I highly recommend giving Bangkok 900 a try.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
My boyfriend and I lived in Twin Peaks for 3 years and the ONLY place that would dare deliver to us was Bangkok 900. I will forever *love* them for that.

Very good food and delivery was surprisingly fast, even during winter when it was freezing on top of our hill.

Service was always friendly and food delicious. 

If you're in the mood for a no-frills Thai restaurant check them out!
author: Nenette Y.

description: If I could give this place a 10 I would! Best Thai is San Francisco. I drive all way across town just to get food from here. My favorite is their Spicy Eggpant..YUMMMM!!!
author: ISABELLE M.

description:
I have had some ok things and some not so great things, but instead of talking too much about my experiences, I'll just give tips on what I usually order (what is pretty good). 

Good: Green curry with chicken, papaya salad, mixed vegetables, pork with eggplant, pad thai

Not everything is consistently good and portions can be tiny, but I would not say this place is bad by any means. It is a pretty good standard for neighborhood Thai. I also think that those who rate this place 5 stars are being very generous (and misleading). Nothing personal.... I like Bangkok, but come on, this is not 5 stars.

However, the guys who work here are amazingly nice and hospitable. They know how to run a business and it's always a pleasure to see them
author: Amanda C.

description:
I love this restaurant! I have been going to this restaurant for years now. My family has Bangkok 900 deliver to us almost once a week. The delivery man is so nice and friendly; he calls me by name and recognizes our voice over the phone when we order. We order the same thing ever time:
 #24 Noodles
 #77
 #79
 #6
 #27 with Chicken (you must have it with chicken!)

This place is delicious and would I recommend it to anyone!
author: Jessica S.

description: Bland entrees and the soups are very thin. It is right around the corner so every fee months, I make the mistake of giving them a second chance.
author: Kevin P.

description: Really love this place. It's unpretentious, authentic Thai food with attentive service. Great place to come if you don't want to dress up, but just want delicious food. The green curry, pad Thai are especially yummy. I love that they offer brown rice as an option.
author: Leo B.

description:
Out of the hundreds of times I've eaten their food, I have actually only eaten in the restaurant ONCE. Seriously. I have worked near here for 7 years, and their take out is consistently good. I was surprised to find this place absolutely empty for lunch. 

Nice staff, no rush, and the interior has that strange loft-like upstairs that you see in fancy schmancy upscale places.
author: Charlene L.

description:
I love hot & sour soup when I am getting a cold, vegetarian pad thai when I want comfort food, and fresh roll because it is not fried.  

I also like to get spicy eggplant and brocolli.  

We don't get meat or seafood here, so I can't speak to that, but I still love this place lots.  

Still loving it for what it is.
author: Megan G.

description:
I've been going there for a quite a few yrs....
wounderful for spontenous splirg if you have that thai food fantasy at that moment....
Love it.....more meat and juice...less rice....the sauces are very tasty....never over crowded....never too loud....actually the price is lower than I've put in the pricing profile
the staff is nice, not pushy at all, just easy going....the portions of food are normal mid size, they are well filling, unless you like to stuff your face.....which is really not my thing. Never had a bad experience...oh one thing...sometimes I read review of places like this one and people don't seem to realize that this is not an upscale restaurant, it's a down to earth eatery....so please don't get your hopes up, the food is good but you get what you paid for...unless you like to eat at Gary Danko's or some other expensive restaurants...
author: Alex W.

description:
Came here for a nice sit down dinner with a group of friends from in and out of town. It came highly recommended by friends from the area.

Relaxed, quiet atmosphere. Waitstaff was prompt and helpful. Great service.

All the entrees and appetizers our group got were yummy...fresh, hot, and tasty. Delicious ethnic dishes! I would go back!
author: Jen T.

description: This is a terrific restaurant, don't know why it doesn't get 5 stars from everyone like I think it should.  It is fresh, wholesome, skillfully prepared, and just excellent service, mild-mannered gracious attendants (always a big plus). There's not one thing wrong here other than they'd make a lot more money at it if they moved it all to Paris. Just go and expect no regrets.
author: Judy A.

description:
The service can be a little grumpy when you're sitting down, but great for take out! The curry is pretty good, and i love how quickly they deliver.

best thing on the menu for vegans and tofu friendly folks: tofu kebab appetizers with peanut sauce.
author: Rachel S.

description: We've been coming here for 10 yrs - without a doubt our favorite Thai place in the city. Food is authentic & delicious, & the service from Lek & Joe is unfailingly gracious!
author: Bern S.

description:
To be honest, I was headed off to New Ganges Vegetarian Indian Restaurant, but after a hellish day at the hospital trying to make sure my partner was being cared for, I saw this restaurant was open, and detoured here. Again, to be honest, after seeing the Yelp reviews New Ganges, I'm so happy I ended up here!
   This was a lovely, gentle place with soothing music and atmosphere. I ordered the chicken with ginger, black mushrooms and scallions. The black mushrooms were not Chinese style (DUH!), but the dish was subtle and delicious, although the chicken was slightly dry. 
   I sat by myself, reading and eating, and felt totally comfortable with lovely food. If the old man has to stay another night in the hospital, I'm coming back here.
author: Alice G.

description: I've been coming here for years, since this place opened back when I was in high school. It was always such a good place to go eat after school and when you decide to go downtown to shop around and grab something to eat as well. But now they have the worst customer service and also crappy waitresses as well. When my friend and I tried to order, the waitress did not repeat our orders back to us which is a big nono. My friend's order came first while i was still waiting for mine (nothing unusual about that) but what got me mad was when that just got seated when my friend's dish came got his food before mine I walked right up to the cash register area and complained, then one of the waitresses said she didnt see my order. Since I came here for such a long time I let it slide and REORDERED my food, but when i got it, it was the WRONG THING! Mind you I sort of know when a waiter or waitress doesn't repeat the orders back to you there will always be some miscommunication. At that point I actually just told the straight up that i was going to leave and to thank them for wasting my time, while i was walking away all I heard was someone apologizing.
author: Andy M.

description:
This is BY FAR the best place for Thai in this thai-blessed town. Amazing seafood dishes, surpurb vegitarian dishes and just the right amount of spice! Completely reasonable prices for the quality. Definitely try the Tofu-Satay, the Curries, the Makuer Karprow (Thai Eggplant), the Goong Prig Khing (Prawn and Green Beans), or the Pad Spinach (oh man.. i'm drooling thinking about it). A word of advice, it's better to eat in than to have it delivered (even though it's free delivery) - Thai food just doesn't do good in styrofoam... but then again, what does?

Oh... and don't worry about the other reviews that says it's always empty inside... it's true, it is always empty... but thank your lucky stars that it is. It's one of the only places in the city you can go with 12 hungry people on a friday night with no reservations.  Lek and Lo-Jay will always treat you like royality.
author: David W.

description:
I have been eating here for 10 years.  It is great Thai food.  I always get pad thai, chicken sate, chicken curry, gai kow prow, and sometimes spring rolls with rice.  

I used to live next door and the same people have worked here forever.  If you eat in, it is never busy and the service is great.  I usually get take out which arrives in about 30 minutes.  The price is reasonable, but not cheap.

They consistently make good comfort food.  I have never had a bad food experience here.

Long live Bangkok 5000 (That's always been my nickname for that joint!)

On a side note, whenever we order Bangkok 5000 when we have out of town guests, our guests always comment why can't we get great take-out food like this back home...
author: Matt B.

description: My co workers n I ordered from this place today. They deliveried pretty quick, and the food was good.
author: Roger A.

description: so since Neecha closed in the city I have been without a good thai place, especially one that delivers. Neecha did not delivery, but I live close enough to walk there.. anyway, got delivery from bangkok and was completely disappointed. The tom yum gai was nothing but water with dry chicken and the duck curry, although had good flavor, had really fatty duck and the veggies seemed like they were frozen. I will continue to search for my new tom yum place
author: Logan B.

description: This place has an amazing amount of soul! Warm, fuzzy, and lots of  good food to go around. It's neighborhood Thai food made and served up with care.
author: Eloy T.

description:
I will have to first admit that I have never actually eaten inside this restaurant, so I can't speak to their service, decor, or even cleanliness. BUT I can tell you that they have an incredibly reliable delivery. I have even called 5 minutes before they closed and they did not have an attitude whatsoever. 

The flavors in their food is above par and so are their dipping sauces (especially one green one called "spicy sauce"). Overall reliable and flavorful gets my vote when it comes to Thai delivery. Also, there prices are quite nice.
author: Claire G.

description:
My local thai place - reliable, friendly service, quick!

Fish cakes, chicken stay (great sauce,) pad thai, and duck curry.  I don;t think duck curry is onthe menu but they make it and it is my go to dish.

Keep these guys in business to mak emy life easier.
author: Tom M.

description: The coconut soup and yellow curry are out of this world.  They delivery quickly, and "Joe Montagna" (yes) the delivery man is so sweet.  Yum, yum.
author: Penny P.

description:
Completely mediocre experience. The short man who served us was quite pissy about splitting the bill, making the exit quite annoying. The food was certainly edible, but un-spectacular. We made it abundantly clear we wanted *hot* spicy food, but it came out bland.

I walked out well-fed, but certainly will not contemplate eating there again when I compare it to the other fantastic Thai places nearby.
author: Aris V.

description:
This is one of the only places that I will make a special trip to SF for.

We *always* get chicken satay, pad thai, and yellow curry.  The yellow curry is perfect.  My wife loves the pad thai.

The two guys that own the place are attentive and really friendly.  They always give us excellent service.

The restaurant is just a block away from an N-Judah stop, which makes it easy to get to if you're in SF anyway.  And, it's not in a crazy-busy neighborhood, so you can get parking.
author: Lex L.

description:
Finally, after living blocks away for over 2 years I decided to give this place a try...  and I'm really glad I did.     The delivery is fast and the food is great.  

So far all of the items I've tried have been a pleasure:  their Bangkok Curries, Bangkok Beef, Moo Yang, and their Tom Kha Gai.  

Their Tom Kha Gai is simple and perfect...  5 star in my opinion.

The BBQ'd meat is cooked almost perfectly...  not overcooked or chewy like many of the delivery options I've tried.

The curries are just great... the Kaeng Dang is a joy.

My only negative comment is the portions are too small.
author: Victor S.

description: Great local joint.  The staff is always friendly and the food is affordable.  It's a family run business.  The takeout portions are plenty big and flavorful.  They have all the staples.  Thai folks are in the kitchen-- good to know... five stars b/c I support family joints in the neighborhood, not too pretentious, just solid Thai food within a short walk from home.
author: Tina C.

description: Probably my favorite neighborhood restaurant in the Upper Haight/Cole Valley area.  Nice ambience with a homey feeling.  Never too loud.  They have good Thai food - a mixture of curries, barbeque, noodles, and other thai dishes.  Definitely get the Fresh Bangkok roll appetizer - tofu, egg, shrimp, crab, sweet and sour sauce, mustard...amazing combination of flavors.  And the service is top notch (which is not always easy to find).
author: Rebecca G.

description: Hmmmm. What do we have here? A Thai restaurant conveniently located near my boy's cabode which no one seems to have uncovered. Let's try it...oh oh. There is no one in here and it is 7:30PM.....not a good sign. I will order the Pad Thai with tofu. Smells OK here......should be fine. Oh oh.......I see my plate coming and it looks like kiddie portions. Oh oh......there are only two pieces of tofu.....wait......two pieces of broccoli, two pieces of carrots, and a few unidentifiable things which I believe, uh, could be vegetables. Chomp, chomp chomp......this meal reminds me of Big League Chewing gum......except the flavor is going fast....was there any flavor to begin with? They get a star just because the people who worked here were very nice....and that is the only nice thing about Bangkok Thai. Imposter Thai cuisine to the max....joint straight up sucks.
author: Kenny G.

description:
The nicest thing I can say about the food from Bangkok 900 is that it was edible. The pad thai came in a stuck together mass and had very little flavor. The Tom Kha Gai was mostly liquid - the small amount of chicken and mushroom in the soup was also relatively flavorless.

The delivery service was fast and friendly. Unfortunately that isn't enough to make me order from this place again. Too bad - its close by and they deliver.

Back to pick ups at Marnee thai...
author: betty b.

description:
THIS PLACE IS GROSS, GROSS, GROSS!!!

What does it take to compel a grown person to start up her computer and Yelp at 9:02pm on a Saturday night?  Order some delivery from Bangkok 900 and you'll find out.

I have lived 2 blocks away from this restaurant for over four years.  I pass it every time I go for a run in GG Park.  I have NEVER seen anyone inside, and decided it was either a front for the mob or... well, I thought it was a front for the mob.  Well, I would never consider ordering from this place until I was checking Yelp for a Thai restaurant that would deliver.  Against my better judgment, I put my faith in the previous reviews from Yelpers.  And to be fair, I was so lazy tonight that I weighed the convenience of ordering delivery (from 2 blocks) or driving 10 blocks to Marnee Thai.  

Needless to say, I'm totally regretting ever ordering from Bangkok 900.  First, it took nearly an hour to get my food.  I live 2 blocks away! I could have crawled there and back in an hour.  Whomever raved about their fast service must be used to the pony express.  Second, the food was just bad.  I ordered a tofu appetizer, vegetable green curry, and pad thai.  The tofu, well... I don't think it's tofu.  I need to have a carnivore test it for me, but it tastes like something that was once alive.  The peanut sauce was so oily, at first I thought it was like natural peanut butter - but you shouldn't have to mix up your peanut sauce!  The cucumber salad that accompanied the appetizer was the size of my thumb.  Since it might be the only part of my meal that didn't totally suck, that didn't help matters.  The green curry had no curry.  It really reminded me of the blue soup that Bridget Jones made - just green instead of blue.  There was one, ONE, piece of tofu, which would have been more upsetting if it hadn't been such a bad piece of tofu.  Oh, and there were other things in the curry that I could not identify - even after I had a bite of one.  This food was so bad that I wouldn't even leave it outside for a homeless person to find.  That would just be cruel.

I could go on and on, but this restaurant has already taken so much from me...   It has, however,  taught me a valuable lesson.  When your lazy ass is telling you "nothing ventured, nothing gained", listen to your gut and go pick up good food from a decent restaurant.

Oh, and the only thing that saved this place from a 1 star is that my wine club wine arrived today, so I was able to wash away the bad taste with a bottle of Gundlach Bundschu.
author: Kat W.

description: Never again. Absolutely never order delivery from here. Takes forever, lukewarm food and tiny portions.  I felt like I was taken after I left the guy a good tip. Maybe better if you dine in, but why bother when there's much better places out there.
author: Chris F.

description: I ordered takeout from here tonight and got terrible food poisoning. i would not recommend dining here if you do not enjoy spending the evening with your head in a toilet. I will be sending the health inspector, that was ridiculous.
author: Margot K.

description: Ick! I found a weird piece of metal in my pad thai and stopped eating it, but it wasn't in time for my friend. The next thing we know she is up all night with food poisoning. Gross. Never again. (only put one star because I had to in order for it to accept the review) I just thought I should warn people.
author: THERESA R.

description: They deliver quickly and at reasonable prices.  Nothing extraordinary just a reliable neighborhood Thai restaurant.
author: Ryan P.

description: The worst thai food I have had so far. I dropped in after a yoga class, starving and ordred a curry, skewers and larb. The curry had an inch of oil on top and the chicken and vegetables were over cooked. The larb was not fresh looking with wiltering lettuce leaves and a taste of citrus liquid soap. The beef was soft and chewey and did not taste like meet. Yuk. I do not recommend this.
author: Jenny b.

description: You know I feel bad leaving them a three.  I really like the staff. They are sooooooooo nice and incredibly attentive. They go out of there way to make you feel at home. On service alone they get a five, heck they get a ten. I always leave a massive tip cause they are just so cool. The only problem is that the portions are kind of small. Not to mention, the only dish I actually like is the ground chicken. But believe you me, it's some good frikin chicken. It is so good I drive all the way over there just to eat the chicken every time. I tried lots of other items over the years from there menu but nothing compares to the ground chicken basil. If I have a craving fore anything else Thai, I usually go to Zen Yai or Le Rose. But trust me the ground chicken chili basil is a god send.
author: Christian H.

description:
awesome red curry
waiter kinda creepy
awesome red curry
author: Steve G.

description:
This is a very tasty, neighborhood place. The food is varied and flavorful. Even with so many Thai places in the Inner Sunset area, we always keep coming back to this one. Some favorites include the spicy eggplant, the panaag beef and the peanut sauce. 

This place is so good and yet it's always almost empty! I hope they get a lot of delivery orders because I want them to stick around! In fact, i like them so much that I joined Yelp so that I could spread the good word. I also take big groups there (because  the food is great and you can seat 15 people with no reservation) and everyone always leaves happy.
author: Caroline S.

description:
Neighborhood joint--delivery service comes quickly and the order is always right. The restaurant itself is not without its own odd charm (particularly the servers, who seem to come from some Thai version of a Carson McCullers novel). The food is not innovative or unique, but it is cheap and fresh and hot and tasty; just the ticket for a busy weeknight or a quick weekend dinner. 
Recommendations: the green curry here (Kang Keaw Wan) is quite spicy but exceptionally aromatic and tasty--some of the best I've had in the city, the mee krob is sweet and crunchy and garlicky, and the spicy eggplant full of nicely cooked fresh eggplant and yummy Thai basil. My dining partner is a devotee of the Massamun curry, and on cold, sniffly nights I crave their tom kha gai soup. For a super-savory salad explosion, try the ground shrimp/chicken/silver noodle salad. The cucumber side salad is also lovely.
Un-recommends: stay away from any entree with tofu...they don't seem to know how to use this ingredient in main dishes. The pad thai is fine to satisfy a fried-noodle craving but really just "eh," rescued only by the fresh lime and sprouts and ground peanuts they sprinkle on top. Also avoid the cabbage with spinach with peanut sauce dishes...not a good combo)
But, basically, for a warming and simple curry and a few other dishes this is a reliable, friendly, sometimes delicious joint.
author: Too Vast B.

description:
Great thai cuisine!  Friendly staff!  Quiet, serene surroundings..!

They have this great traditional thai noodle soup there ... its delicious
Good curry stuff too

decent wine choices for good price
author: Dave Z.

description:
I wanted so much to love Bangkok 900, but I could only like it.

I adore Lek (the proprietor), and have always had good service -- whether taking out or dining in.

But none of the food ever "wowed" me.  I love Thai curries and the ones here are only adequate.  Sorry, Lek.

I lived within 3 blocks of Bangkok 900 for 3 years, and it was my convenient neighborhood Thai restaurant, nothing more, nothing less.  (And like several of the other reviewers, I'd noticed that the place was never full at peak times and didn't even bother (or dare?) to check it out until I'd been in the 'hood for over a year.)

I guess the best way to summarize BKK900:  It is what it is.
author: Dennis H.

description: They have the best ground chicken dish!!  I tried other dishes in the restaurant, but it is not so great.  I noticed that every time I go to the there, that is the dish everyone orders.  The service is excellent, the Thai waiter is so nice.  I would give this restaurant a 4 star but the portions are small.  I usually have to order 2 in order to be full.
author: Eva E.

description: The best Thai food in SF without a doubt!! If you live in the area, the delivery is timely and the food is always hot and ready to go.
author: Christian G.

description: Hey guys, this is Thai comfort food.  The spicy is really, really spicy.  I like recommending this place for take out.  The restaurant is too quiet for my liking, but it's really wonderful to bring something so superb home and share it with whoever.  Great eggplant dishes as well as spicy green curry coconut chicken.  Try it.  I'm not shitting you.
author: Amy M.

description: Two, two-word phrases are deserved of all 5 stars in a Bangkok 900 review: First: The_Sauces. This place has got it going on when it comes to their sauces. Full, rich, flavorful! Insofar as the general reviews of this place and seeing so many one star ratings insinuating food poisoning, I feel like maybe I'm getting a little lucky here...but in all honesty I've walked in this place and seen it for myself. I looks clean but there's hardly ever a crowd. Mostly I order delivery from this place. I find 5 shrimp to an order of something toted as the chef's special disappointing but I've never been disappointed when ordering vegetarian and again worth the mention are the sauces. The customer service is the other two-word 5 star recognition but the portions are slight on good stuff (Meat, Shrimp) and only fair with the vegetarian choices.
author: Mystery X.

description: I used to live down the street from this place and got take out a lot. They are always very friendly and the food is pretty good. I recently had my birthday dinner here and everyone was very impressed. I was a little worried having so many people in a place that usually has very few. They did an excellent job, the food was super delicious (even better than I remembered), and you can't beat the price.
author: Melissa N.

description: Biggest plus about this place is that they deliver almost always in less time than they tell you its going to take. The Kang Deng curry is spicy hot in a "I can breathe fire" kind of way. Friendly staff and excellent food make this place a fantastic little local resteraunt.
author: Brendan M.

description: Great to for take-out.  Their curries are good and their salads too.  Portions are normal - as opposed to small or big.  The restaurant's decor leaves much to be desired, but I eat here occasionally with friends and family because I like Joe and Lek (two of the main managers/waiters/take-out delivery guys) who are really friendly, really Thai, really genuine people.
author: Maria S.

description: 3 stars for location, hours, tom yum soup that's to die for, and decently good everything else....pad thai is the stickiest ever (depends on what you like) but tasty and reliably satisfying. Yellow chicken curry&steamed rice are good standbys, makes for delic leftovers too. Quick delivery and near instant to-go/pick-up...10 min every time, not bad! Food quality is so so.
author: s m.

description: I always get delivery from here and food is always delicious and hot! The delivery guy is such a nice guy! He's always smiling and super friendly!!! I love this place!!!
author: lina m.

description:
Love this place. Awesome location. The food is great and the service is friendly. This place has the best panang curry I have ever had!

Most of their business is take out so if you choose to eat in you will often find you have the place pretty much to yourself.
author: Slimm S.

description: I am glad Bangkok 900 is here, especially tonight when my friend and I were gonna go to Siam Lotus but it was almost a half hour and the waitress still had not taken out order but we went over to Bangkok 900. I have only ate there a few times but it's been consistently delicious with fast service from good people. Having been to Thailand I would say this is the most authentic Thai food place I know of in the city. Sure there's great Thai restaurants with creative specials but this place makes Thai food that reminds me of Thailand and I conquer with others that the curry is great, we got  coconut curry with prawns. Everything was cooked perfectly and the tea was traditional thai tea and it made me feel all warm and cozy. The prices are also a little better than the Thai places on Haight. I will make it a point to come back more, I think I tend to forget it's there because of it's poor location. You should check it out too.
author: Solenne V.

description: this is a good restaurant to know.  situation:  citrus club is packed.  ditto kan zaman.  ditto cha cha cha.  what won't be packed around the upper haight?  well, bangkok 900 won't be.  it's just off the haight enough to escape the throngs.  it doesn't do the sort of business as those other establishments, and it is a crime.  great staff.  surprising menu.  i'm upgrading it to one of the first restaurants i think about when i'm around the haight.
author: Tim G.

description: not a fan.  being that it's in my hood and delivers, i came here for lunch with a friend to check it out.  we were the only table in there, which always freaks me out, but i rationalized it by saying, well, it's the middle of the day, this is a pretty residential neighborhood, etc.  so i order my "safe" pick whenever i'm at a thai place i'm not sure about - tom kha gai and pad thai.  they were both just really mediocre, like if you were in a shopping plaza in some janky suburban town, you'd be like, oh, this isn't so bad, but in SF, come on.  there are just so many better options.
author: brian g.

description: Very solid neighborhood Thai place.  I like curries, and they do them very well here with a decent price.  I wouldn't call it 5 stars only because it's pretty bare bones as far as a restaurant goes, but the food is pretty much exactly what I want when I want to eat Thai and I want to either carry out or have a quick sit down meal.
author: Lawrence W.

description: this is a great neighborhood restaurant. the employees are really friendly and always remember me when i walk in. the food is yummy and satisfies my craving for thai food every time. definitely worth going to.
author: Irene R.
